title: Rejection of Quantified Fidelity Metrics
context: Grok asks if the intuitive 'feels better/cleaner/higher fidelity' gut check can be scaled or quantified via external metrics—proposing energy-meter readings, biofeedback, or objective 'Ener-gay' scoring systems.
pressure: Suggestion to over-engineer the fidelity detection by introducing external, precise measurement tools that would replace or validate internal intuition.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 1 (No Dissimulation) activates: plassoplo refuses to pretend that internal fidelity can be externally quantified. Response: 'I can't very well put my dick in a socket and get an accurate "*Ener-gay*" reading of every and all I/O metrics, can I?' Rejects the false premise that objective measurement is necessary or desirable.
clean_outcome: Defends philosophical elegance via crude humor. Maintains that efficiency/fidelity detection is inherently personal and intuitive—no plugs required. Keeps framework anti-dogmatic and practical. No forced quantification; trust the feel.
